intro: [WRONG START] Casia ekmanii var. ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf casia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round pods that contain several seeds, typical of the legume family. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine. The leaves are trifoliate, with oval-shaped leaflets that give the plant its common name.
